intro: Kedrostis schlechteri, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Kedrostis schlechteri is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance.
